Paul Szerlip and I are pleased to announce our new ECAL paper on evolving S=
odarace-like creatures with HyperNEAT:  

PDF: http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/pape=
rs/szerlip_ecal13.pdf

Abstract: http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publications/2013/=
szerlip-ecal13

For those who don't know, Sodarace creatures are basically =
connectivity patterns of joints and muscles, which makes them a natural mat=
ch for HyperNEAT even though they're not neural networks.  They're lightwei=
ght and cheap to simulate, making them a convenient research platform.  In =
this paper, HyperNEAT combined with novelty search + local competition find=
s a large variety of interesting creatures with diverse ambulation strategi=
es in a single run.  

One of the coolest results of this paper is an inter=
active website where you can see a visualization of the whole space of evol=
ved creatures all at once (generated through PCA), and click on individual =
points to see the corresponding creature in action:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.ed=
u/ecal13/demo/PCA.html

Best,

ken
